column1: Velloor (also known as Mevelloor) is a village in the Vaikom Taluk of the Kottayam district in Kerala
Regular bus services are available to the towns Vaikom
column3: Ernakulam and Kottayam. The Piravam Road railway station is situated in Velloor. Nearest towns are Piravom and Vaikom. The nearest airport is Cochin International Airport and which is just 1 h 42 min (53.3 km) away from Velloor.

column1: There are four large and medium scale industries functioning in the panchayath. The only central public sector undertaking in the panchayat is the Hindustan Newsprint Limited
column2: which is engaged in the production of newsprint. The main private sector company in the area is Cochin Cements Limited manufacturers of ACC Cements. These two companies provide employment to a large no of locals.

column1: The scenic beauty of velloor is that much mesmerizing to attract the tourists. Velloor is located in Kottayam District of Kerala.
The village lies on the banks of the Muvattupuzha River and is about 12 kilometres (7.5 mi) from Vaikom. Piravom Valiyapally (10 km)
column3: and Kanjiramattom Mosque (10 km) are important shrines in the region. Hindustan Newsprint Limited is a major landmark here. Piravam Road railway station is the nearest railhead.
